intro: Trisetum distichophyllum subsp. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved basket grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinct two-ranked arrangement, giving it a unique appearance. It is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained conditions.
